validationErrors.email: * Please provide a valid email address

aboutScreen.title: About the Study
aboutScreen.description:
The goal of this study is to determine if you can test yourself for influenza (the 'flu') at home. The first test involves taking a swab from inside your nose, swishing that swab in a tube of liquid, putting a test strip in the tube for 10 minutes, and then removing it and telling us what you see on the test strip. The second test is just taking a swab from inside your nose and putting that swab in a tube of liquid. As one of the first people to try these tests, you'll play an important role in helping us find ways to better manage and understand the flu in the future.

Taking part in this study is completely voluntary. You can stop at any time; however, it greatly helps us if you finish all steps as described in the flu@home app.

fundingScreen.title: Study Funding
fundingScreen.description:
The flu@home app is developed, operated, and owned by Audere. For questions about the app, please email **[flu-support@auderenow.org](mailto:flu-support@auderenow.org)**.

The flu study is funded by the Brotman Baty Institute at the University of Washington.

partnersScreen.title: Partners
partnersScreen.description: This study is funded by the Brotman Baty Institute and is being conducted by the University of Washington in conjunction with Fred Hutch.

generalQuestionsScreen.title: General Questions
generalQuestionsScreen.description:
**Why are you conducting this study?**

The goal of this study is to understand if people who are sick should test themselves at home for the flu using a new test. As one of the first to try it, you'll play an important role in helping us find ways to manage flu symptoms in the future.

**If I feel better by the time I receive the test kit in the mail, should I still conduct the test?**

We are very glad to hear you're feeling better, however we'd still like you to complete the tests and send the kit back to us. We can still learn from your illness.

**How can I find out if the test says I have the flu?**

Unfortunately, we aren’t able to provide that information as part of this study. Its purpose is to learn whether a flu test can be done from the comfort of your home. We don't have enough information yet to tell you whether you do or do not have the flu, but if you believe you might have it, we suggest you visit your personal doctor.

**Are you using my swab samples to test for other conditions besides the flu?**

Your sample will be stored after the completion of the study and may be used for future research. Your sample will only be labeled with a study code and will not be labeled with your name or other identifying information.  We would not be able to give you the results from any other research done using your sample. This practice of storing samples so researchers can use them in the future is called “banking.” Researchers also bank information/samples so they can share them with other researchers.

**Will you share the overall study results with me?**

We’d be happy to. Once you're done with the tests, you’ll have the opportunity on the **Opt-in to messages** page to request a final copy of this study’s outcome results. Note that individual test results will not be included. If you opt in we'll be sure to email you a copy of the final study report, which should be ready in less than six months. If you missed this opt-in step, please email us at [flu-support@auderenow.org](mailto:flu-support@auderenow.org) and we'll ensure you get a copy of the final report.

**Is it ok to hold onto the completed test for a few days before I send it back?**

It’s important we receive your samples as soon as possible to ensure the most accurate results. To make it easier, you can ship your box from your personal mailbox or by scheduling a pickup from your home. We appreciate you completing this step right away, preferably the same day you finish the test.

**Will you consider me for future studies?**

Absolutely. Just click the “Contact me next flu season” option on the **Opt-in to messages** screen after you complete both tests. If you missed this opt-in step, please email us at [flu-support@auderenow.org](mailto:flu-support@auderenow.org) and we'll add you to the contact list for next flu season.

**Who should I contact if I feel that I've been harmed by participating in this study?**

If you have questions about the study or if you have been harmed by participating in it, please contact the principal investigator, Matthew Thompson, at [fluhelp@uw.edu](mailto:fluhelp@uw.edu). If you have questions about your rights as a research subject, you can call the Human Subjects Division at (206) 543-0098. Please reference the following number when contacting the study subject adviser: Study 00006388

**After I finish the tests, can I delete the app?**

Yes, after you finish the tests and return the kit back to us you can delete the app. You will receive an email survey a week after you return your kit, but you don't need to use the app to take the survey.

**Who is eligible to participate in the study?**

To participate, you must be 18 years or older, be located in the mainland United States, and have flu-like symptoms.

problemsScreen.title: Problems With the App
problemsScreen.description:
**My app unexpectedly closed in the middle of the test. What should I do?**

Open the app again on your {{device}} and it should be on the same page as when it closed. If you need to go back to a previous step, there is a **←** button at the top left of the screen.

**Something went wrong with the app. What should I do?**

If the app is stuck, try closing it on your {{device}} and reopening it.
On an iPhone or iPad with a circle button at the bottom, double click the button, swipe to find the flu@home app, then while touching the app image, swipe it up and off the screen. This will close the open app. After this you can re-open the app. It should return to the original step you were on. If that doesn't work, email us at [flu-support@auderenow.org](mailto:flu-support@auderenow.org).
On an iPhone with no circle button, swipe up from the bottom to get to the list of active apps, then while touching the app image, swipe it up and off the screen to close the app. Then re-open it to continue.

testQuestionsScreen.title: Test Questions
testQuestionsScreen.description:
**Why do I need to perform two tests?**

Having access to more than one nasal swab allows our researchers to compare your samples and double-check test results. Your first test swab is examined using one kind of machine in the lab, while the second is tested on a different, ultra-sensitive machine. Together, both samples help us verify the accuracy of our at-home testing kit.

**Do I follow the same instructions for both tests?**

No, they’re a little different so please follow the instructions in the app closely. The first test is more involved—but don’t worry, the app screens will walk you through each step for both tests.

**How long will the two tests take me?**

It should take around 20 minutes from start to finish.

**My completed test swab accidentally dropped or came into contact with something else. Should I still submit it?**

Yes. Even if you dropped the swab or it touched another surface, please do your best to continue with the test steps.

**Is it ok if I left the nasal swab in the tube longer than the designated time?**

Yes. If you left the swab in for a little longer than the timer, please just continue to follow the rest of the steps. 

**Is it ok if I left the test strip in the tube longer than the designated time?**

Yes. If you left the test strip in for a little longer than the timer, please just continue to follow the rest of the steps.

**Why do I need to answer so many personal questions?**

Understanding the conditions surrounding your illness helps us put your potential flu results in context. It also enables us to look for trends among the larger group of participants. Thank you for your willingness to share your information.

**Will you share my personal information with anyone else?**

No, we will not share your personal information with any third party or for purposes other than this study.

**Will my personal information be kept confidential?**

You will not be identified personally in any report or publication about this study. We will assign a study code to you and all your identifiable information such as your name and address. These will be kept in a separate, secure database where the researchers do not have access as they look at the other study data.
Government or university staff sometimes review studies such as this one to make sure they are being done safely and legally. If a review of this study takes place, the Institutional Review Board (IRB), who approved this study, and other accrediting agencies may inspect and copy your records--which may have your name on them. They would only do this to ensure you were treated fairly and safely during the study.

**Do the pink or blue lines on the test strip mean I’m more likely to have the flu?**

The blue and pink lines help us understand how the test is performing. You should not consider them conclusive of whether or not you have the flu.

**After I ship my kit back is there anything else I need to do?**

You will receive an email about a week after you ship your kit back, which has a few questions to let us know how you're feeling. It is important for us to receive this final information to complete your participation in the study.

**Will I need to pay to return the test kit?**

No, we have included a prepaid United States Postal Service (USPS) return label in the test kit.

**What is the UN3373 sticker for?**

UN3373 is the US government’s shipping code for biological samples. Since you will be mailing a nose swab sample, it must be shipped according to applicable government, International Air Transport Association (IATA), and International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) regulations.

giftcardQuestionsScreen.title: Gift Card Questions
giftcardQuestionsScreen.description:
**When will I receive my gift card?**

Shortly after you receive your kit and start using the app, we’ll ask for your email address. This is where we'll send your gift card after we receive your completed test kit back in the mail. Look for your gift card in your email inbox within a week after you mail your kit back to us.

**I prefer not to share my email address. Can you send my gift card to my home address instead?**

Unfortunately, we can only email gift cards at this time. Rest assured we will not share your email address with anyone else if you choose to provide it. Thank you for your understanding.

**I provided my email address, but I still haven’t received my gift card. What should I do?**

We're sorry you haven't received your gift card yet. If you have already returned your test kit to us more than a few days ago, please email us at [fluhelp@uw.edu](mailto:fluhelp@uw.edu) and we will make sure you get your gift card.

contactSupportScreen.title: Contact Support
contactSupportScreen.description:
**I have questions about the test kit contents.**

For questions about the test kit, email **[fluhelp@uw.edu](mailto:fluhelp@uw.edu)** or call (509) 593-3964.

**I have questions about the study in general.**

For general study questions, email **[fluhelp@uw.edu](mailto:fluhelp@uw.edu)** or call (509) 593-3964.

**I have a support issue regarding the application.**

For support with issues with this application, please contact **[flu-support@auderenow.org](mailto:flu-support@auderenow.org)**.

consentScreen.name: Please enter your full name
consentScreen.description: Please read and accept the consent form by scrolling to the bottom and clicking "I consent"
consentScreen.consentFormHeader1:
University of Washington
Informed Consent Document
CONFIDENTIAL
consentScreen.consentFormHeader2:
**INFORMED CONSENT DOCUMENT**
**AGREEMENT TO BE IN A RESEARCH STUDY**
consentScreen.consentFormText:
Sponsor / Study Title: “A community wide study to evaluate the accuracy of self-testing for influenza.”

Principal Investigator: Matthew Thompson, M.D., Ph.D. (Study Doctor), University of Washington Medical Center
 
Telephone: (509) 593-3964

Additional Contact(s): Monica Zigman-Suchsland MPH (Study Staff)

Address: Department of Family Medicine, Box 354696, University of Washington, Seattle, WA 98195-4696

**Researchers’ statement**
We are asking you to be in a research study. The purpose of this form is to give you the information you will need to help you decide whether to be in the study or not. Please read the form carefully. You may ask questions about the purpose of the research, what we will ask you to do, the possible risks and benefits, your rights as a volunteer, and anything else about the research or this form that is not clear. When we have answered all your questions, you can decide if you want to be in the study or not. If you decide to take part in this research study, you will be asked to agree to this form. You will be given an opportunity to receive a copy of the form via email. You should keep your copy for your records. It has information, including important names and telephone numbers, which you may wish to refer in the future.

**PURPOSE OF THE STUDY**
This goal of this study is to determine if people in the community can test themselves for influenza (the ‘flu’). This will involve you taking a swab from inside your own nose, doing a test on this swab, and reading the results of this test. 

**STUDY PROCEDURES**
To take part in this study, you need to have symptoms that are common in a flu like illness. 

We will ask you to download an app onto your own smartphone/device, and complete a short questionnaire about yourself and your illness. Your answers to these questions will help us know if you have a flu-like illness. Your answers will also allow us to ship a testing kit to your home. 

When you get the testing kit (within 1-2 days), you will follow instructions and take two swabs from inside your nose. The nasal swab is collected by gently putting a swab (like a Q-tip) about ½ inch inside your nose and gently turning it around. One of these you will use to run a simple test (that looks a bit like a pregnancy test) yourself, following instructions. You will be reading the results of the test, however, these results are experimental only and should not determine whether you should visit your doctor for treatment. You are to continue to use your best judgment for treatment based on your symptoms.

The other swab you will return to us in the mail. We will follow up with you after 1 week by the app, text, email or phone to ask you about your illness. Once that questionnaire is completed, a gift card will be sent to you either via email or mail.

Once your swab is returned, the genetic material from the virus will be tested to determine the strain of the virus. 

While participating in this research study, you must be willing and able to follow the study directions and procedures. You must also tell the study staff about any side effects or problems. You should ask any questions as you think of them, and tell the study doctor or his designee if you change your mind about staying in the study.

**RISKS, STRESS, OR DISCOMFORT**
The research team will make every effort to maintain strict confidentiality of the data. Some people may feel uncomfortable taking a swab test from their nose. Rarely this might cause a small nosebleed. We cannot tell you if you have flu or not with the test, and this may make you feel anxious. If you are worried about flu or your health you should seek care from a primary care clinician. 

**BENEFITS OF THE STUDY**
You will not have any direct benefit from participating in this study. However, you will be contributing to the development of a new way to test for flu in the future.

**CONFIDENTIALITY OF RESEARCH INFORMATION**
Your record will be kept confidential. You will not be identified in any report or publication about this study. 

The researchers will keep the study data confidential. We will obtain your name and address from the App, and use this to mail you the test kit. We will also use the app/text/email/phone to send you the survey at 1 week follow up. 

We will assign a study code to you. Your identifiable information such as your name and address will be kept in a secure database where the researchers do not have access. When we publish or present the results of this study, we will not use any information that will identify you.
 
Government or university staff sometimes review studies such as this one to make sure they are being done safely and legally. If a review of this study takes place, your responses in the interview may be examined.
 
The Institutional Review Board (IRB) and accrediting agencies may inspect and copy your records, which may have your name on them. Therefore, total confidentiality cannot be guaranteed. If the study results are presented at meetings or printed in publications, your name will not be used.
 
**SOURCE OF FUNDING**
This study is funded by the Brotman Baty Institute at the University of Washington.

**OTHER INFORMATION**
Taking part in this study is voluntary. You can stop at any time. You may refuse to participate and you are free to leave the study at any time, without any effect on your relationship or employment with your clinic or the research team.
If you have questions about the study, or if you have been harmed by participating in this study, please contact Matthew Thompson at fluhelp@uw.edu. If you have questions about your rights as a research subject, you can call the Human Subjects Division at (206) 543-0098. You can keep a copy of this information form for your records.
 
Please reference the following number when contacting the Study Subject Adviser: Study 00006388

**SPECIMEN BANKING**
Storing samples so researchers can use it in the future is called “banking.” Researchers also bank information/samples so they can share it with other researchers. Your sample would be stored after the completion of the study and may be used for future research. Your sample will only be labeled with a study code and will not be labeled with your name or other identifying information. We would not be able to give you the results from research that is done using your sample. 

You will not be able to remove your sample from banking.

**Storage and Use of Specimens for Research:**
This research will not be done to help you and you will not be compensated for allowing additional research use of your samples. The use of leftover samples for research may lead to the development of commercial products. You will not be paid if this happens. If we want to use your samples for other research or share it with other scientists for research, an ethics review committee (IRB) would review the request. The IRB would decide if we need to ask for your consent to do the research.
 
By signing this consent form you are giving your permission for these researchers to use your samples for future use.

**PAYMENT FOR BEING IN THE STUDY**
You will receive payment of $$$ in the form of a gift card per completion to compensate for time and expenses related to participating in the research study. You will receive payment within two weeks of your last study visit. 
 
**AGREEMENT TO BE IN THE STUDY**
This consent form contains important information to help you decide if you want to be in the study. If you have any questions that are not answered in this consent form, ask one of the study staff.

**CLOSING STATEMENT**
You have read the information which has been stated above and have received satisfactory answer to all of the questions which you have asked and you willingly agree to this consent form. You will be offered a copy of the informed consent form, if requested. You hereby consent to be a participant in this study.
 
**RESEARCH-RELATED INJURY**
If you think you have been harmed from being in this research, contact Dr Matthew Thompson at fluhelp@uw.edu or 509-593-3964.

**Subject’s statement**
This study has been explained to me. I volunteer to take part in this research. I have had a chance to ask questions. If I have questions later about the research, or if I have been harmed by participating in this study, I can contact one of the researchers listed on the first page of this consent form. If I have questions about my rights as a research subject, I can call the Human Subjects Division at (206) 543-0098 or call collect at (206) 221-5940. I will have the opportunity to receive a copy of this consent form.
consentScreen.privacyNotice: We will not share your personal information with any third party or for purposes other than this study.

surveyTitle.whereKit: Where did you get your kit?
surveyTitle.consentEmail: Email me a copy of this consent form
surveyTitle.whatSymptoms: Which of the following were present during your illness?
surveyTitle.symptomsStart: How long ago did symptoms start?
surveyTitle.symptomsLast48: Were these symptoms present in the last 48 hours?
surveyTitle.inContact: In the past week, have you been in contact with a person who seemed to have a cold?
surveyTitle.youngChildren: In the past week, have you been in contact with any children under five years old for over an hour?
surveyTitle.householdChildren: Are there any children under 18 years old in your household?
surveyTitle.childrenWithChildren: Do any children in your household attend a school, childcare setting or play group with at least three other children for a total of three or more hours per week?
surveyTitle.peopleInHousehold: How many people live in your household (including you)?
surveyTitle.bedrooms: How many bedrooms are in your home?
surveyTitle.medicalCondition: Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have one of the following medical conditions?
surveyTitle.fluShot: Did you get a flu shot in the last year?
surveyTitle.fluShotDate: What was the date of your flu shot?
surveyTitle.householdTobacco: Does anyone in your household smoke tobacco?
surveyTitle.interfering: Is your illness preventing you from going to work or school, going to social events, or exercising/working out?
surveyTitle.antibiotics: Are you currently taking antibiotics (e.g. Amoxil, penicillin, Z-pack, Bactrim, Augmentin) or antivirals (e.g. Tamiflu, Xofluza, Relenza) for this illness?
surveyTitle.assignedSex: What is the sex on your medical records?
surveyTitle.race: How would you describe your race?
surveyTitle.healthInsurance: What kind of medical insurance do you have?
surveyTitle.blueLine: Do you see a blue line in the middle of the test strip?
surveyTitle.redLine: Is there a red line on your test strip?
surveyTitle.firstTestFeedback: Do you feel you performed all the steps in the flu test correctly?
surveyTitle.secondTestFeedback: How do you feel you performed the second test?

surveyDescription.addressDesc: Please provide your home address and email. We will send the gift card to your email.
surveyDescription.mailingAddressDesc: Please provide your shipping address and email. We will send the flu test kit to your address and the gift card to your email.
surveyDescription.symptomsStart: Select the time frame that best applies
surveyDescription.fatigue: Feeling tired or more tired than usual
surveyDescription.symptomsSeverity: Select the level of discomfort you felt at the worst point
surveyDescription.medicalConditions: Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have one of the following medical conditions?
surveyDescription.blueLine: The line may be faint, but as long as you see it you can answer Yes to the question.
surveyDescription.optInForMessages: We will have information to share regarding the outcome of this study and we will be expanding the study next flu season. Please select the items below we can contact you about, or if you're not interested, just click Continue.

welcomeScreen.description: We know you aren't feeling well right now. Thank you for participating even when you're ill. As a thank you, you'll receive a $$$ gift card at the end of the study after we receive your completed test kit in the mail. Let's get started.

whyScreen.description: The goal of this program is to understand if people who are sick should test themselves at home for the flu using a new test. Although you won't learn whether or not you have the flu as part of this study, you'll play an important role in helping find ways to manage it in the future.

whatScreen.description: We need to ask a few questions about you and the symptoms you're feeling. In addition, you will need to provide your home or mailing address so we can send the flu test kit to you.
whatScreen.whatBlockKits: What do I need to do?
whatScreen.blockKitsDesc: Due to high demand, we have stopped taking new orders for the time being. We appreciate your interest and hope you feel better soon!

addressScreen.title: Email and Address
addressScreen.addressExceptions: Test kits will only be shipped to addresses in the mainland United States. Hawaii and Alaska are not included.

ageIneligibleScreen.description: We're sorry, but this study is aimed at adults 18 years and older.

symptomsIneligibleScreen.description: At this time your symptoms do not meet the criteria to continue. If your symptoms change, you can open this app again on a different day.
symptomsIneligibleScreen.disclaimer: This is not medical advice. We suggest you consult your doctor for your illness as you normally would.

consentIneligibleScreen.description: We're sorry, but you need to agree to the consent form in order for you to participate in the study. If you change your mind, click the "Back to consent" button below.

confirmationScreen.confirmed: Thank you! Your flu test kit has been ordered.
confirmationScreen.description:
You are now enrolled in the study. The flu test package should arrive at your home within the next 1-2 days. When you receive the kit, open the flu@home app on your {{device}} and it will tell you what to do.

If you have questions regarding the study itself, contact the study coordinator at:(509)593-3964.

Want to learn more?
confirmationScreen.disclaimer: The kit is for your use only. Please do not share or use the kit with anyone else after you receive it.

pushNotificationsScreen.pushNotifications: May we send you push notifications?
pushNotificationsScreen.description: We'll only notify you of content interesting and relevant to you, such as: shipping status of your kit, gift card details at the end of the study, and flu information.

extraInfoScreen.extraInfo: Interested in sharing this or learning more?

welcomeBackScreen.description: Sorry, we know you're feeling bad and appreciate your participation. Before we get started, find a location with good lighting (we'll need you to take a picture of a test strip later)  and make yourself comfortable. Today you'll be completing two tests, which allows us to double check your results. The whole process should take about 20 minutes total.

whatsNextScreen.description:
Both tests involve taking nose swabs, then returning them by mail using a shipping label provided in the box. As a thank you for all your help, we'll email you a gift card once we receive your completed test kit.

Before you begin, find a flat surface where you can place the kit. Be sure it is away from pets and children.

beforeScreen.flatStep: Find a flat surface where you can place the kit. Be sure it is away from pets and children.

scanInstructionsScreen.description: First, we'd like you to scan the barcode found on the inside cover of your box. To do that, we'll need to access your {{device}}'s camera.
scanInstructionsScreen.tips:
**Tips:**

Hold the camera so the barcode is in the middle of the camera.

If it's too dark, please adjust your lighting.

scanScreen.cameraAccess: Camera access needed to scan barcodes.
scanScreen.invalidBarcode: {{barcode}} doesn't look like a flu@home kit barcode. Please try again.
scanScreen.cameraWarning: "flu@home" would like to access your camera

scanConfirmationScreen.description:
Thank you. Your barcode was successfully scanned. This will help us know the kit came from you when you return it to us.

Next up, you'll be performing two tests with your kit and answering some questions about your symptoms.

manualEntryScreen.barcodeRequired: Please enter your kit's barcode to continue.
manualEntryScreen.dontMatch: Those barcodes don't match. Please try again.
manualEntryScreen.invalidBarcode: {{barcode}} doesn't look like a flu@home kit barcode. Please try again.
manualEntryScreen.desc: Enter the code found below the barcode symbol on the inside cover of your flu kit box.
manualEntryScreen.tips:
**Tips:**

Find the blue barcode on the inside cover of your box.

The code is directly below the barcode.

manualConfirmationScreen.description:
Thank you. Your barcode was successfully entered. This will help us know the kit came from you when you return it to us.

Next up, you'll be performing two tests with your kit and answering some questions about your symptoms.

testInstructionsScreen.title: How the test works
testInstructionsScreen.description: We'll walk you through all the necessary steps in the following screens--from doing the tests using the items in the kit to shipping it all back and getting your gift card.

unpackingScreen.title: How the test works
unpackingScreen.description:
We'll walk you through all the necessary steps in the following screens. First let's check to make sure your kit is complete.

You should have an introduction card, a box with a number ①①, a bag with a number ②②, a bag with a number ③③, and some bubble wrap.
unpackingScreen.kitMissingItems: Is your kit missing items? Email us.

swabScreen.title: Begin the first test
swabScreen.description:
Open box ①① and remove all the items.

Take out the small tube with the grey top, remove the stopper, and stand up the tube in the hole marked "Small tube" on the box. **Keep** the stopper for later.

swabPrepScreen.title: Prepare tube
swabPrepScreen.description: Carefully twist open the saline (salt water) vial and squeeze the liquid into the sample tube. Do so slowly and carefully so all the liquid gets into the tube.

openSwabScreen.title: Open nasal swab
openSwabScreen.description:
Remove the nasal swab from the wrapper by pulling the two ends of the wrapper apart (like you would do to open a band-aid).

Be careful not to drop it, and only touch the handle, not the tip.

mucusScreen.title: Collect sample from nose
mucusScreen.description: Gently insert the **entire** soft tip of the swab into one nostril. Rub it around the inside wall of the nostril four times. Next, gently insert the same swab into the other nostril and rub it around the same way.

swabInTubeScreen.title: Put swab in tube
swabInTubeScreen.description:
Place the swab into the tube sitting in box ①①. Make sure the swab tip is touching the bottom of the tube and stir it around 4 times.

Click "Start Timer" below. The swab needs to stay in the tube for one minute.

firstTimerScreen.title: Did you know?
firstTimerScreen.note: Keep swab in the tube for one minute
firstTimerScreen.tip: If you are sick with flu symptoms, the CDC recommends that you stay home for at least 24 hours after your fever is gone, except to get medical care or for other necessities.
firstTimerScreen.tip2: To avoid the flu, wash your hands using soap and water, especially after touching commonly shared items. Hand washing is one of the most basic and proven methods for preventing the spread of disease.

removeSwabFromTubeScreen.title: Remove swab from tube
removeSwabFromTubeScreen.description:
Carefully rub the tip of the swab against the wall of the tube as you pull it out. You want to squeeze as much liquid out of the swab as possible.

Throw the swab in the trash. You won't need it again.

openTestStripScreen.title: Open test strip
openTestStripScreen.description: Inside the same box ①① you'll find a test strip in a white pouch with purple printing. Open this package by tearing from the top where there is already a small cut.

stripInTubeScreen.title: Put test strip in tube
stripInTubeScreen.description:
The arrows on the test strip should be **pointing down** as you lower it into the tube. Make sure the strip is touching the liquid in the bottom.

Leave the test strip in the tube. It needs to be there for at least 10 minutes. We will let you know when to take it out. In the meantime, please answer some questions so we can better understand how this illness has affected you.

surveyCoverScreen.title: Questions for you
surveyCoverScreen.description: The strip needs to stay in the tube for at least 10 minutes. While we're waiting, please answer some questions for us. We'll tell you when to take the strip out of the tube.

surveyScreen.title: Symptom Survey
surveyScreen.description: Questions marked with an * are required.
surveyScreen.expoDesc: In the next section, the questions are going to be about being in contact with people who seem to have a cold. In contact means being within six feet of them for at least two minutes or physical contact for any amount of time.
surveyScreen.expoRef: For reference, six feet is about the distance between you and someone sitting two rows ahead of you on the bus.
surveyScreen.generalDesc: Next, we'd like to ask you some questions about your overall health.

thankYouSurveyScreen.title: Thank you!
thankYouSurveyScreen.desc: Your answers, along with the tests, help us to understand many factors related to your illness.
thankYouSurveyScreen.waiting: Now, just wait for the time to end and the app will direct you to the next steps.

testStripReadyScreen.title: Remove test strip
testStripReadyScreen.desc: Please remove the test strip from the tube and place it flat on the middle of box ①①.

testStripTimerScreen.title: Time Remaining: **{{time}}**
testStripTimerScreen.desc: **Please wait for the timer to end.**

finishTubeScreen.title: Finish with the tube
finishTubeScreen.description: Put the stopper back on the sample tube you just took the test strip out of. You'll be sending this back to us. We'll walk you through packaging steps shortly.

lookAtStripScreen.title: Look at the test strip
lookAtStripScreen.description: We are going to ask you a few questions about what you see on the test strip. Please try to look at it in good lighting. Answer YES if you see any of the lines mentioned, even if they are very faint. There is no right or wrong answer here, we're just interested in knowing what you see.

testStripSurveyScreen.title: What do you see?
testStripSurveyScreen.desc: Hold the test strip with the arrows pointing down when answering the following questions.

pictureInstructionsScreen.title: Take a photo of the strip
pictureInstructionsScreen.desc:
We know that was a lot of steps and appreciate you hanging in there with us.

Next, take a photo of the test strip. Lay the test strip on box ①① so it's flat with the arrows pointing down towards you. When you're ready, click the Continue button to use the camera.

testStripCameraScreen.title: Place test strip next to the sample below, centered in the box.
testStripCameraScreen.description:
Tap the screen to focus the image, and try to use good lighting.
When ready, tap the round button to take a photo.

testStripConfirmationScreen.title: Photo captured!
testStripConfirmationScreen.desc: Thank you for continuing with the test. Next, we'll get our first test items put away.

cleanFirstTestScreen.title: Clean up the first test
cleanFirstTestScreen.step1: Find the medium-sized bag with a green barcode on it.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step2: Put the test strip inside that bag, remove the white strip on the bag and seal it.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step3: Open bag ②② and take out the tube with the red top and the swab package. Leave the soft material in the bag.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step4: Place the bag with the green barcode and the tube with the grey top into bag ②②. Please ensure the grey stopper is tight on the tube.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step5: Keep the box in front of you. You'll need it for the next test.

firstTestFeedbackScreen.title: Nice job with the first test! One more to go.

beginSecondTestScreen.title: Begin the second test
beginSecondTestScreen.description:
This test has fewer steps than the first one and some steps are different, so please read carefully.

Find the tube with the red top. Holding it straight so the liquid inside doesn't spill, open the top. Place the tube in the box hole marked "Large tube" so it's standing up. Keep the top for later.

prepSecondTestScreen.title: Prepare for the test
prepSecondTestScreen.description: Open the swab package. Be careful to not drop it, and try to only touch the handle--not the tip of the swab.

mucusSecondScreen.title: Collect sample from nose
mucusSecondScreen.description:
Now you'll swab your nose the same way you did during the first test:

Gently insert the **entire** soft tip of the swab into one nostril. Rub it around the inside wall of the nostril four times. Next, gently insert the same swab into the other nostril and rub it around the same way.

swabInTubeSecondScreen.title: Put swab in tube
swabInTubeSecondScreen.description: Place the swab directly into the tube and put the red top back on the tube tightly. (No need to add saline as you did with test 1).

cleanSecondTestScreen.title: Clean up the second test
cleanSecondTestScreen.description: Put the tube with the red top into the same bag ②② as the other items to be returned.

secondTestFeedbackScreen.title: Nice job with the second (and final) test!

packingScreen.title: Packing things up
packingScreen.description: You will be using the same box that was shipped to you to send everything back. Open bag ③③, and inside, you'll find everything you need to pack up your box.

stickersScreen.title: Put stickers on the box
stickersScreen.description:
Apply the return mailing label to the outside of the box, **over** the label with your address on it.

Add the UN3373 sticker to the side of the box. This sticker just means there are samples inside.

secondBagScreen.title: Put bag ②② in the box
secondBagScreen.description:
Bag ②② should have the small tube, the large tube, a bag with the test strip, and some absorbent material (just in case anything spills in transit).

Close bag ②② by removing the white strip on the top of the bag and sealing the bag.

Ensure the bubble wrap is still in the box.

You can throw out the rest of the items you used, or put them in the return box if it's easier.

tapeBoxScreen.title: Tape up the box
tapeBoxScreen.description:
Find the tape strip. There are multiple pieces of tape provided on the strip, stacked one on top of each other.

**Pull** a single tape strip off by holding the white edge. Adhere the provided tape lengthwise to the long seam of the box over the word "Open." Remove the white backing from the tape edge to seal the tape strip completely. You may have tape left over.

shipBoxScreen.title: Shipping your box
shipBoxScreen.description:
Now that your box is ready to go, please mail it **as soon as possible**. The return postage is pre-paid, so you can mail your package normally, provided it fits in your local mailbox. 

If you don’t have an outgoing mail service to leave the package with, locate a nearby USPS location, blue mailbox, or schedule a pick-up from your location.

schedulePickupScreen.title: Schedule a pickup
schedulePickupScreen.description:
You will be directed to the USPS site where you can enter the pickup address.

The mailperson can pick up the package directly from your doorstep while on their typical route. Indicate the following items on the form:
schedulePickupScreen.rule2: Pick-up during your **regular mail delivery** so there is no additional charge.  The weight of the package is **1 lb**.

emailOptInScreen.title: Opt-in for messages
emailOptInScreen.description: We will have information to share regarding the outcome of this study and will be expanding the study next flu season. Please select the items below we can email you about, or if you're not interested, just click Continue.

thanksScreen.title: Thank you!
thanksScreen.description:
Your participation could help us stop the spread of the flu, lead to personalized treatments, smarter prevention, and a safer and healthier world for all of us.

In about one week you will receive an email with a quick follow-up survey to check in and see how you're feeling. Please reply as soon as you can to that message.

Your gift card will be sent to {{email}} within a week after you mail your completed test kit back.

In the meantime, what can you do now?
thanksScreen.disclaimer: Please remember, the results of these tests are experimental and are not to be used as medical care. Consult your doctor as you normally would for your sickness.

links.recommendLink: Recommend flu@home to a friend who's not feeling well
links.learnLink: Learn more about this flu study
links.medLink: Search Maps for urgent care clinics nearby

surveyOption.sendCopyOfMyConsent: Send me a copy of my consent
surveyOption.askAboutMyIllness: To ask me questions about my illness/cold
surveyOption.learnAboutStudy: To learn more about this study and related topics
surveyOption.fatigue: Feeling tired or more tired than usual
surveyOption.noInsurance: I do not have medical insurance
surveyOption.nativeHawaiian: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
surveyOption.sendMeStudy: Send me the study outcome report
surveyOption.contactMeForFollowUpStudy: Contact me in a couple months to participate in a follow-up study (Note: You will be compensated for your time)

surveyButton.noContactUnderFive: No contact with children under 5 yrs old
surveyButton.noRed: No, there are no red lines
surveyButton.yesAboveBelowBlue: Yes, above and below the blue line
surveyButton.yesOneRed: Yes, there is one red line
surveyButton.yesTwoRed: Yes, there are two red lines
surveyButton.easyCorrect: It was easy to follow and I think I completed the test correctly
surveyButton.confusingCorrect: It was a little confusing but I think I did the test correctly
surveyButton.confusingNotCorrect: It was very confusing and I'm not sure I completed the test correctly
surveyButton.incorrect: During the test, I realized I did something incorrectly
